newsitem.title: USA: Police lead man from Philadelphia hostage site.
newsitem.headline: Police lead man from Philadelphia hostage site.

text.p: A man emerged with his arms in the air from a check-cashing building in Philadelphia where 40 to 60 people were taken hostage earlier Friday, local media reported.

Television pictures showed police leading the man from the building. It was unclear whether he was a hostage or hostage-taker. Philadelphia police said earlier they were seeking to remove people one-by-one in an effort to make sure robbers did not slip out with hostages.
The man was taken to a police trailer. More people inside the building were lined up alongside a window.
"What we're doing is trying to get the people out of here safely," Philadelphia police deputy commissioner Richard Zappile told reporters before the man emerged.
Zappile said as many as eight robbers were involved in the incident, which began Thursday night with an apparent kidnapping attempt.

Radio and television stations reported that the robbers intended to use one or more employees of the Financial Exchange, a check-cashing business, to gain entrance the next morning in an apparent attempt to rob an armoured car. But the attempt apparently went wrong and led to the hostage situation.
